intro: Draba nubigena, commonly known as the alpine penny-cress, is a small flowering plant native to the high alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. It produces yellow or white flowers and has a compact growth habit adapted to harsh mountain environments. Draba nubigena is often found in alpine meadows and is a member of the genus Draba, which includes many species adapted to cold climates.
